data.title: Nobel Prize Museum
data.text:
A day at Slussen (En dag pÃ¥ Slussen)

6 June 2024

On Thursday, 6 June , the section of Slussen called Vattentorget, which connects Gamla Stan and SÃ¶dermalm, will open. Welcome to our tent to learn more about the Nobel Center, which will open in 2031.

Sensory storytelling - workshop on scents and smell

31 May 2024

Scents have the power to move us through time and space and bring memories to life. Why do they affect us so strongly and what do we know about our sense of smell?

Everyone's Right to Medicine

24 May 2024

Every year, millions of people die because they lack access to medicine. This is despite the fact that there are now medications for more diseases than ever before. How can this be, and what can be done about it?

Friday night mingle with guided tours

10 May 2024

Start your weekend with us during this Friday evening. Mingle with friends in the bistro and in the exhibitions, and join our knowledgeable guides as they give a tour of These things changed the world.

How did this happen?

3 May 2024

Since the Nobel Prizes began to be awarded, they have been criticized and questioned. We make our way through discoveries that went awry, laureates that ended up awry and prizes that made people angry.

Man and machine - Science Today in Reaktorhallen

26 April 2024

How are smart machines changing us and our future? In this eighth edition of Science Today, we enter the Reaktorhallen at KTH and explore the theme of Man and Machine.

Culture Night: Who can you trust? A conversation with med Emma Frans

20 April 2024

Weâre open until midnight. Come and enjoy music, a conversation on stage and guided tours. Challenge your friends in our quiz and mingle in Bistro Nobel where DJs play all night long.

Friday night mingle with guided tours

19 April 2024

Start your weekend with us during this Friday evening. Mingle with friends in the bistro and in the exhibitions, and join our knowledgeable guides as they give a tour of These things changed the world.

Intelligence of nature, an audiovisual concert with Ali M Demirel and Portrait XO

12 April 2024

What secrets, mysteries, and answers can nature offer? Welcome to an audiovisual concert that explores the intelligence of nature and what we can learn from it.

Friday night mingle with guided tours

5 April 2024

Start your weekend with us during this Friday evening. Mingle with friends in the bistro and in the exhibitions, and join our knowledgeable guides as they give a tour of These things changed the world.

Friday night mingle with guided tours

29 March 2024

Start your weekend with us during this Friday evening. Mingle with friends in the bistro and in the exhibitions, and join our knowledgeable guides as they give a tour of These things changed the world.

Concert with jazz saxophonist HÃ¥kon Kornstad

22 March 2024

Welcome to an atmospheric concert with HÃ¥kon Kornstad, award winning Norwegian jazz saxophonist. Through live recorded samples and improvisation, all his performances become truly unique.Â

Woman, Life, Freedom â conversation and concert

15 March 2024

Gilda Hamidi-Nia och Mohammad Fazlhashemi talk about courage and the fight for human rights in Iran. Concert with pianist Hara Alonso who will play music from her album Notions of hope.

Opening night of the new exhibition These things changed the world

8 March 2024

Welcome to the opening night of These things changed the world. Live music, mingle, and Bistro Nobel's specially curated menu will guarantee a festive start of the weekend.

Quiz night about food

1 March 2024

Welcome to spend time with friends, learn something new and enjoy dishes from our Friday menu when we present a quiz night with the theme of food and drink in Bistro Nobel.Â

Science Today â Energy powering ourselves and the world

23 February 2024

Welcome to Science Today - an evening that will kickstart your brain and the weekend with today's most exciting research and some of Stockholm's best DJs.

Pop-up scene with poetry and jazz

16 February 2024

A warm welcome to a poetic and musical evening marking the beginning of the spring season at the Nobel Prize Museum!Â

Evening tour in our Fungi exhibition

5 January 2024

The world of fungi is still full of mysteries, waiting to be solved.â¯This evening, you will learn more about all of this through a guided tour that delves into our exhibition Fungi - Mushrooms in Art and Science.

Evening guided tour about this yearâs Nobel Prizes

29 December 2023

Join us for a Friday evening as we delve deeper into this year's Nobel Prizes, exploring their potential to transform and improve our world and be beneficial to us all!Â

Evening guided tour about this yearâs Nobel Prizes

22 December 2023

Join us for a Friday evening as we delve deeper into this year's Nobel Prizes, exploring their potential to transform and improve our world and be beneficial to us all!Â

Why Women Won â Lecture by economic sciences laureate Claudia Goldin

11 December 2023

In December, Claudia Goldin will be in Stockholm to receive the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel. On this occasion, she will deliver a lecture.

The Nobel Day 2023

10 December 2023

Welcome to celebrate the The Nobel Day with us! Enjoy a festive Nobel Lunch in the bistro, join a guided tour, and see fashion creations inspired by this yearâs prizes.

Nobel Week Dialogue 2023

9 December 2023

The Nobel Week Dialogue 2023 will bring people together from across the spectrum of science, society and culture to explore the future of migration and how to approach that future.

Evening guided tour about this yearâs Nobel Prizes

8 December 2023

Join us for a Friday evening as we delve deeper into this year's Nobel Prizes, exploring their potential to transform and improve our world and be beneficial to us all!Â

Science Today - sustainable and innovative materials

24 November 2023

How are functional materials becoming more intelligent and what does the potential to reduce emissions look like? We will explore the future of new materials during our 6th edition of Science Today.

Being Human â a theater performance.

19 November 2023

In a mix of theater, dance, and performance, the audience will experience a series of texts where love, war, betrayal, and hope follow one another.

Bubbles and Identity - with Emma StenstrÃ¶m

17 November 2023

Emma StenstrÃ¶m, researcher at the Stockholm School of Economics, describes social identity as bubbles and suggests that we can become more open, creative, and attentive by becoming aware of - and leaving - our bubbles.

Fungi - threat or cure?

14 November 2023

Welcome to see our exhibition Fungi - In Art and Science and listen to a conversation between Hanna Johannesson and Anna Rosling about possibilities and threats in the world of mushrooms.

Evening tour in our Fungi exhibition

10 November 2023

The world of fungi is still full of mysteries, waiting to be solved.â¯This evening, you will learn more about all of this through a guided tour that delves into our exhibition Fungi - Mushrooms in Art and Science.Â

Evening guided tour about this yearâs Nobel Prizes

3 November 2023

Join us for a Friday evening as we delve deeper into this year's Nobel Prizes, exploring their potential to transform and improve our world and be beneficial to us all!Â

Being Human â a theater performance

29 October 2023

In a mix of theater, dance, and performance, the audience will experience a series of texts where love, war, betrayal, and hope follow one another.

Garden of Ghost Flowers

28 and 29 October 2023

Become a member an participate as a co-creator in a new AR-artwork with digital plants, that will be shown in our ongoing exhibition.

Evening tour in our Fungi exhibition

20 October 2023

The world of fungi is still full of mysteries, waiting to be solved.â¯This evening, you will learn more about all of this through a guided tour that delves into our exhibition Fungi - Mushrooms in Art and Science.Â

The mushroom kingdom - a world of food and opportunities

13 October 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a delicious tasting in two parts, with inspiration from the fascinating world of mushrooms!Â Chemical engineer and mushroom consultant Lena Engelmark EmbertsÃ©n will be your guide.

The Prize in Economic Sciences at the Riksbank â panel discussion

9 October 2023, The Riksbank

What will it be this year? Members of the economics prize committee talk about this year's economics prize and explain the research behind it.

A family weekend with a literary theme

7-8 October 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Celebrate this year's Nobel Prizes and learn more about writing. Take part in an author visit, writing workshop, story time and family tours.

This year's Nobel Prize laureate(s) in literature

5 October 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Discover this yearâs Nobel Prize laureate(s) in literature just hours after the announcement. Listen to some of those who were involved in making the decision talk about the author(s) and more.

Crash Course on the year's scientific Nobel Prizes.

4 October 2023, SÃ¶dra teatern

When was the last time you explained a Nobel Prize to your friends? Welcome to an evening where we celebrate the 2023 scientific Nobel Prizes with a performance in two acts.

Live-streamed announcements of the year's Nobel Prizes

2-9 October 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

We will live-stream when each Nobel Prize committee announces who will be awarded this yearâs Nobel Prize in its field. We will have experts on our stage, who help us understand what achievements are being rewarded.

A family weekend with a scientific theme

30 September-1 October 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Gear up for this yearÂ´s Nobel Prizes by learning more about scientific experiments, and join us at the family opening of our new exhibition about mushrooms.

Opening night

29 September 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to the opening night of our new exhibition Fungi â In art and science with: audiovisual works, introductory guided tours by the exhibition's curators, concert with Modern Biology (Tarun Nayar).

Determination and Change - Conversation with Nobel Peace Prize laureate Tawakkol Karman

28 September 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Tawakkol Karman meets with Carin Klaesson from the Nobel Prize Museum in a discussion about courage, determination, and how injustice against an individual is injustice against all humanity.

Nobel Calling Stockholm

28 September - 9 October 2023

During the first week of October, this year's Nobel Laureates will receive their magic phone call. The Nobel Prize Museum will be your guide throughout the week, presenting topical conversations and programmes.

Freedom of speech in focus

27 September 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Meet Dmitry Muratov in a conversation with journalist and author Ingrid Carlberg and philosopher and author Ã sa Wikforss about freedom of expression, democracy and lasting peace.

Concert with cellist Dobrawa Czocher

22 September 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a concert with cellist Dobrawa Czocher who loves to explore new aspects of the cello sound, mixing classical and contemporary music.

Quiz night in the name of love!

15 Sepember 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

What happens in the brain when we fall in love? Are there any Nobel Prize laureates who have been married to each other? And which novel has the best love story?Â Welcome to a quiz night where we explore love.

An ear for language â a night about translating Nobel Prize laureates in literature

8 September 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a conversation about the art of translation, a translatorâs many considerations and decisions and the final text where nothing of this should be noticeable.Â

Learn chess with Lavinia Valcu

17 and 18 June 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

Lavinia Valcu comes to the Nobel Prize Museum to give her best chess tips to both beginners and children who already play chess. All children between 8-12 years are welcome!

Concert with duo AVAWAVES

26 May 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum invites the contemporary classical duo AVAWAVES who will offer a concert experience where the musical interaction in the moment, is at the center.Â

Are you curious about the ideas behind the Nobel Prizes?

19 May 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A warm welcome to a Friday evening at the Nobel Prize Museum where we learn about the creative environments of some Nobel Prize laureates and how they got their ideas.

An evening dedicated to the author PÃ¤r Lagerkvist with KG Hammar, Bo SundstrÃ¶m and Frida Ãhrn

12 May 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a conversation about PÃ¤r Lagerkvist's rich authorship. During the evening, we will also hear Lagerkvist's poems set to music performed.

Science Today â the Human Body

5 May 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

In what way can we optimize our body? In what way can we avoid or improve functions and senses in the body? Science Today takes the temperature of science in 2023.

Stockholm Culture Night 2023 â Peace Party

22 April 2023, Nobel Prize Museum

During the whole evening you can make paper cranes inspired by ICAN in our origami workshop, enjoy delicious food and drinks in our bistro or join a guided tour.

Are you curious about the ideas behind the Nobel Prizes?

21 April 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A warm welcome to a Friday evening at the Nobel Prize Museum where we learn about the creative environments of some Nobel Prize laureates and how they got their ideas.

Quiz â What do you know about the Nobel Prize?

14 April 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

From Einstein to Obama â the Nobel Prize contains all the world's questions. Who discovered radioactivity and who wrote Waiting for Godot? Bring a competitive friend or we'll form teams on the spot.

Are you curious about the ideas behind the Nobel Prizes?

7 April 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A warm welcome to a Friday evening at the Nobel Prize Museum where we learn about the creative environments of some Nobel Prize laureates and how they got their ideas.

Russia and the Nobel Prize â dissidents and dreams of democracy

31 March 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A conversation with Stig Fredrikson and Stefan Ingvarsson about some Nobel Prizes that have been both widely praised and severely criticized â all critical voices of the regime and with a dream of a better society.

Champagne tasting

24 March 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to an evening when sommelier Ulrika Karlsson guides a tasting with a selection of champagnes served at the Nobel Prize banquet.

The discovery of a new kind of human - a conversation with Mattis Karlsson

17 March 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

In a conversation with Gustav KÃ¤llstrand, cultural researcher Mattis Karlsson talks about how the discovery of the Denisovan became a scientific breakthrough.

Are you curious about the ideas behind the Nobel Prizes?

3 March 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A warm welcome to a Friday evening at the Nobel Prize Museum where we learn about the creative environments of some Nobel Prize laureates and how they got their ideas.

Science Today â foodtech

24 February 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Will we eat differently in the future?Â After our first meetings about The Complexity of the Brain, Space Exploration and Genetics it is now time to focus on the Food of the future!

Conversation with Jonna Bornemark

10 February 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A warm welcome to a conversation about the limits of the self and other ambiguities with the philosopher Jonna Bornemark and the Nobel Prize Museum's Carin Klaesson.

Concert with Angus MacRae

3 February 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

During the coldest month of the year, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum invites you to an intimate concert with the composer and producer Angus MacRae.

The Memor

25, 26 and 28 January 2023, Liljevalchs

Welcome to an interactive experience during the exhibition Life Eternal at Liljevalchs created by the Nobel Prize Museum. The Memor is a choreographed space that passes through the visitor's body like a song.

The Future of Research

October 2022 - January 2023, Liljevalchs

Take the chance to meet some of Sweden's most promising young researchers. In collaboration with Young Academy of Sweden, quizzes, conversations and mini lectures with interactive elements are organized during the autumn

Are you curious about the 2022 Nobel Prizes?

20 January 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

For this evening you can buy a ticket for 200 SEK which includes entrance, a guided tour, a glass of bubbly and a snack!

Is the conversation possible? - AI and communication on eternal issues

19 January 2023, Liljevalchs

Open lecture by Archbishop emerita Antje JackelÃ©n, followed by a conversation about what the human is and how we evolve in a world of digitalisation.

Are you curious about the 2022 Nobel Prizes?

13 January 2023, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

For this evening you can buy a ticket for 200 SEK which includes entrance, a guided tour, a glass of bubbly and a snack!

Opening of Nobel Creations and Guided tours about this year's Nobel Prizes

16 December 2022, Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to the opening of Nobel Creations 2022! Meet the students behind the creations, have a glass of bubbly in the bistro, and take the opportunity to go a guided tour. We are open in the evening until 21:00.

Nobel Week Lights 2022

3-11 December 2022, Stockholm

Nobel Week Lights Stockholm is an annual light festival that takes place during Nobel Week in December. Read more and see the entire programme here!

Nobel Week Dialogue 2022

Friday 9 December 2022, Stockholm Waterfront Congress Centre

The Nobel Week Dialogue is organized by The Nobel Prize and is open to the public. Read more here!

The ruthless power of poetry â a talk with Nobel Prize laureate Louise GlÃ¼ck

8 December 2022, Nobel Prize Museum

Louise GlÃ¼ck was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2020 "for her unmistakable poetic voice, which with austere beauty makes the existence of the individual human being universal".

Physics laureate Andrea Ghez talks about black holes

6 December 2022, Nobel Prize Museum

How do you discover something that is not visible? What can the black hole teach us about the history and future of our galaxy? And are we sure that black holes are black holes?

Light it up!

2 December 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

During this evening we will meet artists participating in the light festival Nobel Week lights and enjoy the audiovisual performance by music artist Hara Alonso and visual artist Jaime Reyes.Â

Symphony of a Missing Room

1 December 2022, Liljevalchs

Symphony of a Missing Room isÂ a guided tour where the visitors depart on both a collective and an extremely personal journey using sightless goggles, voice instructions and three-dimensional sound.

Science Today - genetics and gene technology

18 November 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

In this Science Today we will explore genetics and the development of genetic engineering. We will talk about DNA and dive into different types of genetic research and the building blocks of genetic codes.

Live Podcast: Did World War I End? A conversation with Dick Harrison

11 November 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Hear historian Dick Harrison talk about "the war to end all wars" and why the war did not. The conversation is led by the Nobel Prize Museum's Gustav KÃ¤llstrand and is recorded for the podcast Ideas that change the world

Are you curious about this year's Nobel Prize?

4 November 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

For this evening you can buy a ticket for 200 SEK which includes entrance, a guided tour, a glass of bubbly and a snack!

Live podcast: The vital blood - with Gustaf Edgren

28 October 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

What is a blood type? What connection do they have to different diseases? And why is blood really so important? The blood researcher Gustaf Edgren tells in a conversation all about how the blood works.

Champagne tasting with Nobel Prize banquet sommelier Ulrika Karlsson

21 October 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to an evening at the museum when sommelier Ulrika Karlsson guides us through an exciting tasting. We will try some carefully selected champagne once served at the Nobel Prize banquet.

After Work and evening hours with guided tours about this year's Nobel Prizes

14 October 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

From 17:00 you are welcome to the Nobel Prize Museum, which is open until 21:00. During the evening, you can join a guided tour where you will find out more about the new Nobel Prize laureates who will come to Stockholm.

Nobel Calling Stockholm 2022

1-10 October 2022

During the Nobel Calling week, you will meet researchers, Nobel Prize laureates, academy members, and many more when the Nobel Prize Museum, together with a number of actors, organizes activities all over Stockholm.

The Prize in Economic Sciences at the Riksbank â panel discussion

Monday 10 October 2022, Riksbanken

The Prize in Economic Sciences shows us that economics covers a lot more territoryÂ â it is also about human behaviour, relationships and improving our societies. Members of the economics prize committee will explain.

Peace Friday

Friday 7 October 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A lone activist or a political leader? A grassroots organisation or a United Nations agency? Over the years, the Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to a broad range of recipients.

A conversation about the 2022 Literature Prize

Thursday 6 October 2022, Nobel Prize Museum

Now it's time to hear how they thought this year. Members of the Nobel Committee tell us who received this year's prize and why - and give tips on what to start reading to get to know the prize winner!

Crash Course on the year's scientific Nobel Prizes

Wednesday 5 October 2022, Filmstaden Skandia-Teatern

What scientific discoveries are being rewarded this year? Join us for our Crash Course and hear directly from the Nobel Prize committees on who they selected and why their discoveries are so important.

Life in space - conversation with Nobel Prize laureate Didier Queloz

1 October 2022, Liljevalchs

Is there life in space? When the first planets outside our solar system were discovered, we could seriously begin to investigate the conditions for life in space. But what should we be looking for?

The fight for global compassion â a conversation with Nobel Prize laureate Kailash Satyarthi

30 September 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Indian activist and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Kailash Satyarthi has worked against slave labor and child trafficking for decades. Welcome to a conversation about courage, justice and compassion.

Cocktail tasting beyond the ordinary

23 September 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a taste journey expressed in cocktails with inspiration from Alfred Nobelâs various homes and places he visited during his many travels.

Science Today - an exploration of space

16 September 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

After our first meeting The Complexity of the Brain, we will now dive deeper into the infinity of space and take the temperature of where space research is today.

Freedom of expression and the road to peace - Maria Ressa at the Nobel Prize Museum

15 June 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a conversation about freedom of the press, democracy, and the conditions of journalists with Maria Ressa and the Nobel Prize Museum's Carin Klaesson.

In-depth exploration of reality with Nobel Prize laureate Frank Wilczek

10 June 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Come and listen and get a new view of reality when the Nobel Prize Museum's Gustav KÃ¤llstrand talks to Frank Wilczek - one of the greatest physicists of our time.

Explorative electronica with Peter Sandberg

3 June 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Inspired by the disparity between the idyllic Scandinavian landscape and the complex narratives and emotions of modern life. Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum have invited Peter Sandberg!

After Work and evening hours with guided tours focused on peace work

15 and 22 April 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a late night at the Nobel Prize Museum where exhibitions, bistro and our shop are open until 21.00! We also offer guided tours focused on peace work.

A cocktail tasting beyond the ordinary!

20 May 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a taste journey expressed in cocktails with inspiration from Alfred Nobel's various homes and places he visited during his many travels.

Inauguration of the new Bistro Nobel

6 May 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to celebrate the inauguration of a newly renovated Bistro Nobel! We promise an evening filled with music, bubbly and appetizing snacks with international influences.

Nobel Prize laureate Abdulrazak Gurnah visits the Nobel Prize Museum

29 April 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a conversation where the 2021 Nobel Prize laureate in literature Abdulrazak Gurnah and the Nobel Prize Museum's Carin Klaesson talk about exile, alienation and identity.

Stockholm Culture Night 2022 - Truth and consequence

23 April 2022, Nobel Prize Museum

What does freedom of speech really mean, and can we take it for granted? What drives Nobel Peace Prize laureates and their constant work for free journalism?

Science Today - the complexity of the brain

8 April 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Science Today takes the temperature of science in 2022 and invites PhD or Postdoc candidates to present their research and their momentum as emerging researchers.

Evening hours with guided tours focused on peace work

1 April 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to a late night at the Nobel Prize Museum where exhibitions, bistro and our shop are open until 21.00! We also offer guided tours focused on peace work.

To portray the incomprehensible

25 March 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

A Conversation with Aris Fioretos, poetry, literature, and opera. Welcome to an evening with descriptions of the Holocaust.

Challenging and hypnotic with Mario Batkovic

18 March 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

By mixing classical and contemporary music, the composer and producer Mario Batkovic seeks to explore the possibilities of the accordion.

Friday night with a focus on female Nobel Prize laureates

11 March 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

This evening we offer a special guided tour focusing on female Nobel Prize laureates whose civil courage and bravery have contributed to making the world a little better.

Afterwork and evening hours at the Nobel Prize Museum

4 March 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

You are welcome to join us for a full evening at the Nobel Prize Museum, when our exhibitions, bistro and shop will stay open until 21:00.

Afterwork and evening hours at the Nobel Prize Museum

25 February 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

You are welcome to join us for a full evening at the Nobel Prize Museum, when our exhibitions, bistro and shop will stay open until 21:00.

Exclusive tea tasting at the Nobel Prize Museum

18 February 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Together with The Tea Centre of Stockholm, we offer a unique tasting where we discover flavors from different teas with connection to Nobel Prize laureates around the world.

Piano session with LUCHS

4 February 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

LUCHS combines acoustic tones from the piano with electronic influences to create a calm, moving harmony. Welcome to LUCHSÂ´ piano session at the Nobel Prize Museum!

What is life? â featuring Sir Paul Nurse

21 January 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Sir Paul Nurse â geneticist, cell biologist and Nobel Prize laureate â has studied the fundamental mechanisms of life throughout a long scientific career.

Afterwork and evening hours at the Nobel Prize Museum

14 January 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

You are welcome to join us for a full evening at the Nobel Prize Museum, when our exhibitions, bistro and shop will stay open until 21:00.

Afterwork and evening hours at the Nobel Prize Museum

7 January 2022, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

You are welcome to join us for a full evening at the Nobel Prize Museum, when our exhibitions, bistro and shop will stay open until 21:00.

Festive AW evening with guided tour and bubbly

17 December, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Put on your most festive outfit and join our afterwork evening including an exhibition tour of The Nobel Prize Banquet â behind the scenes.

Nobel Week Lights 2021

4-12 December 2021, Stockholm

Nobel Week Lights festival is back with 22 new installations. Read more here!

Dinner party on the Nobel Day

10 December 2021, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

We invite you to a special dinner party on the Nobel Day with a program inspired by the Nobel Banquet. The festive dinner takes place in Bistro Nobel, signed by chef Sebastian Gibrand.

Vernissage and AW evening

3 December 2021, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Welcome to the opening of Nobel Creations 2021! Meet the Beckmans students behind the creations, have a glass of bubbly in the bistro, and take the opportunity to see our other exhibitions. We are open until 21:00.

A poetic tribute to Wislawa Szymborska + a concert featuring Hania Rani

19 November 2021, Nobel Prize Museum

You are warmly welcome to a full evening programme at the Nobel Prize Museum about WisÅawa Szymborska, the Polish poet and Nobel Prize laureate and a concert with Hania Rani!

Festive AW evening with guided tour and bubbly

5 November 2021, Nights at the Nobel Prize Museum

Put on your most festive outfit and join our afterwork evening including an exhibition tour of The Nobel Prize Banquet â behind the scenes.

Nobel Calling Stockholm 2021

4-11 October 2021

Celebrate and understand this year's new Nobel Prizes! In early October the world's gaze will turn towards Stockholm as the 2021 Nobel Prize laureates are announced.

German pianist Lambert performs at the Nobel Prize Museum

1 October 2021, Nobel Prize Museum

The first of many Friday nights at the museum during the autumn will be rather mysterious. Donât miss the masked pianist Lambert performing his music at the museum.
